messages.subject: Re: I'm not leaving the list
messages.msgSnippet: Joy Have you considered clicking edit my membership for your yahoo group lists and choosing the option of no email?  This is the way I manage my groups; I
messages.messageBody:
Joy

Have you considered clicking "edit my membership" for your yahoo
group lists and choosing the option of "no email?" This is the way I
manage my groups; I just go to the group website and check the
messages there, avoiding clogging my private email account. You
could also choose daily digest to come to your personal account.

Aimee

messages.subject: I'm not leaving the list
messages.msgSnippet: For those who care, LOL! I m not leaving the list, just change email addy s. I didn t like how my messages would get held up when post from my msn acct so I
messages.messageBody:
For those who care, LOL! I'm not leaving the list,
just change email addy's.
I didn't like how my messages would get held up when
post from my msn acct so I opened up a yahoo acct. My
messages get posted so much faster now, but I hate
having to jump through hoops just to check it. So back
to msn.
I'm also unsubbing from a ton of lists. I can't handle
600+ posts a day on one acct. I have like 10 of them.
<g>
Joy in NM


=====
Learn from others, but go to your own school

Joy in NM
Homeschooling mom of two
Michael Alexander 16 yo
Kenna Rose 13 yo
Married 17 years to Scott

__________________________________________________

Get email alerts & NEW webcam video instant messaging with Yahoo! Messenger. http://im.yahoo.com

messages.subject: started a new list
messages.msgSnippet: This way, if the kids are afraid to start out being the first to write, I started an email list for them. It WILL be monitored! I also have to approve all new
messages.messageBody:
This way, if the kids are afraid to start out being the first to write, I
started an email list for them.

It WILL be monitored!

I also have to approve all new members so you will get a post from me if
your child, like mine, has his/her own account as I need your permission
for the child to join it.

This way, I know that they are not a spammer or worse :o)

The address for this is http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschooledfriends

Hope to see you or your kids there!

Jessi
